questions.question: 1. What spectrum of light does IR spectroscopy correspond to?

explanations.b: This range corresponds to Ultraviolet rays.
explanations.c: This range corresponds to Visible light.
explanations.d: This range corresponds to Infra-red rays (IR).

questions.question: 2. What type of molecular phenomenon does IR spectroscopy correspond to?

explanations.a: Molecular rotation corresponds to Microwave spectroscopy.
explanations.b: Molecular Vibration corresponds to Infra red spectroscopy
explanations.c: Electronic vibration corresponds to Ultraviolet - visible spectroscopy
explanations.d: Molecular translation would correspond to X-rays if at all.

questions.question: 3. Which of the following chemical changes will IR spectroscopy be able to capture?

answers.b: Cleavage of C-O bond in CO<sub>2</sub>.
answers.c: Striking of CO<sub>2</sub> gas to the walls of the container.
answers.d: Excitation of CO<sub>2</sub> to a higher electronic state.

explanations.a: Rotation of any molecule will lead to transitions among its rotational states, leading to Microwave spectroscopy.
explanations.b: C-O bond cleavage occurs due to the vibration of this bond and hence this will include transitions among the vibrational energy levels,leading to IR spectroscopy.
explanations.c: Striking of CO<sub>2</sub> gas to the walls of the container increases the energy of the molecules but does not affect its internal vibrations, and hence cannot be detected by IR spectroscopy.
explanations.d: Transitions among electronic energy levels can be captured by UV-Visible spectroscopy.

questions.question: 4. Which of the following statements is true concerning infrared (IR) spectroscopy?

answers.a: IR spectroscopy is used to determine the frequency of vibrations between atoms
answers.b: The fingerprint region is most easily used to determine the functional groups in the molecule
answers.c: IR spectroscopy is used to determine the shape of the carbon backbone
answers.d: IR spectroscopy can be used to easily determine molecular mass

explanations.a: IR spectroscopy is most commonly used to determine the functional groups found in the molecule being observed. This is done by observing the vibration frequencies between atoms in the molecule.
explanations.b: IR does not easily reveal the size or shape of the molecule's carbon skeleton.
explanations.c: Although the fingerprint region is unique for every molecule, it is very difficult to read when attempting to determine the molecule's functional groups.
explanations.d: IR spectroscopy cannot be used to determine molecular mass but can be used to determine the change in molecular mass due to change of an atom with its isotope.
